intro: Coreopsis oligantha, commonly known as the narrowleaf coreopsis, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky soils. The plant features slender stems with lance-shaped leaves and produces bright yellow flowers in the summer months. Its flowers are composed of ray florets and tubular disc florets, typical of the Asteraceae family. Coreopsis oligantha is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
